Html:
Hi,

Can anyone please share a sample hello world snippet for View Discovery using MEF in Prism.

Thanks in advance.

Regards,

Indro

Hi Indro,

You might find the Exercise 2 in the MEF Hands-On Lab of the Prism Training Kit useful to learn more about how to use View Discovery with MEF.

Inside Exercise 2's end solution, in the Infrastructure Project you will find the ViewExportAttribute which is used to decorate views that you want to be registered on a specific region (View Discovery Approach). Take into account even it is a Silverlight Project, it could be easily ported to a WPF application.

Additionally, you can read the following links of MSDN Prism Documentation:

  • Chapter 7: Composing the User Interface (specifically in section Displaying Views in a Region When the Region Loads)
  • Chapter 2: Managing Dependencies Between Components

Also, you can check the Stock Trader Reference Implementation for an example of the usage of the aforementioned attribute in the context of a complex solution.

I hope you find this information useful.

Thanks,

Miguel Bronzovic
